definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: We were overjoyed at the news of China haying launched another man-made satellite.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到中国又发射了一颗人造卫星时都很高兴。

sentences.english: Many countries have set up man-made satellites to circle the earth.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家已发射了人造卫星环绕地球。

sentences.english: e.g: They have launched a man-made satellite successfully.
sentences.chinese: 他们成功地发射了一颗人造卫星。

sentences.english: The first man-made satellite of our country weighs 173 kilogrammes.
sentences.chinese: 我国第一颗人造卫星重173公斤。

sentences.english: The United States launched its firstsatellite in 1958.
sentences.chinese: 美国在1958年发射其第一颗人造卫星。

sentences.english: It was their third man-made satellite that they launched last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期他们发射的是他们的第三颗人造卫星。

sentences.english: It was their third man-made satellite that they sent last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期他们发射的时他们的第三棵人造卫星。

sentences.english: Our country can made man- made satellite.
sentences.chinese: 我们的国家能造人造卫星。

sentences.english: China has never admitted to having an anti-satellite weapons programme.
sentences.chinese: 中国从来没有承认过自己有反人造卫星武器计划。

sentences.english: They orbited three satellites in a single month.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一个月之内把三颗人造卫星射入轨道。

sentences.english: They're going to send up another man-made satellite next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年他们将要发射另一颗人造卫星。

sentences.english: Our country sometimes uses man-made satellites to send and receive TV programmes.
sentences.chinese: 我国有时候使用人造卫星发送和接收电视节目。

sentences.english: The satellite is covered with a smooth shell of ice.
sentences.chinese: 人造卫星上覆盖着一层平滑的冰壳。

sentences.english: In 1970,China successfully lauched a man-made satellite.
sentences.chinese: 1970年，中国成功地发射了一颗人造卫星。

sentences.english: Wireless satellite connections are expensive, he points out.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，无线人造卫星连接是昂贵的。

sentences.english: If you count artificial satellites, things get chillier still.
sentences.chinese: 如果把人造卫星也算在其内，就可以使物体变得更冷。

definition: moon landing/to land on the moon
